name: B. Problems for Round
statement:
There are problems prepared for the next Codeforces round. They are
arranged in ascending order by their difficulty, and no two problems
have the same difficulty. Moreover, there are pairs of similar problems.
Authors want to split problems between two division according to the
following rules: Problemset of each division should be non-empty. Each
problem should be used in exactly one division (yes, it is unusual
requirement). Each problem used in division 1 should be harder than any
problem used in division 2. If two problems are similar, they should be
used in different divisions. Your goal is count the number of ways to
split problem between two divisions and satisfy all the rules. Two ways
to split problems are considered to be different if there is at least
one problem that belongs to division 1 in one of them and to division 2
in the other.Note, that the relation of similarity transitive. That is,
if problem is similar to problem and problem is similar to problem , it
doesn’t follow that is similar to .
